blockdesc-post-*:
Acts as a 'home' for Soldiers to loiter and protect.
Repair using a hammer.
command-help-kingdom: /kingdom [ create | delete | update | invite | become | depart | revolt | rebels | attack | treaty | outlaw | pardon | wanted | voting ]
command-help-culture: /culture [ create | delete | update | invite | become | depart ]
command-help-update-culture-append: /culture update append [ mascs | femms | names | skins | pupil | hairs | style | extra | beard ] 'arguments'
command-help-update-culture-remove: /culture update remove [ mascs | femms | names | skins | pupil | hairs | style | extra | beard ] 'arguments'
command-help-update-culture-getall: /culture update getall [ basic | mascs | femms | names | skins | pupil | hairs | style | extra | beard ] 'arguments'
command-help-update-kingdom: /kingdom update [ append | remove | rename | colour | player | elects | getall ]
command-help-update-kingdom-rename: /kingdom update rename [ roles | title | longs | descs | ruler | names | short ] 'arguments'
command-help-update-kingdom-colour: /kingdom update colour [ first | secnd | third ] 'Hex codes'
command-desc-kingdom: Handles creation, deletion, updating, invitation, departure, and war of/between kingdoms.
command-desc-culture: Handles creation, deletion, updating, invitation, and departure of player cultures.
command-desc-depart: Leaves the {0} you are part of, but does not allow you to keep claims.
command-desc-revolt: Begins a revolution against the {0}'s leader.
command-desc-rebels: Leaves and rebels against the {0} you are part of, allows you to keep claims.
command-desc-usurps: Begins a revolution to overthrow the {0} leader.
command-desc-outlaw: Outlaws a specific player to be an enemy of the {0}.
command-desc-pardon: Pardons a specific player to not be an enemy of {0}.
command-desc-wanted: Gets the currently outlawed fugitives of this {0}.
command-desc-voting: Casts vote for one of the options in the {0}.
command-error-isleader: [ERROR] Cannot {0} while you are the leader!
command-error-ownsland: [ERROR] Cannot leave {0} while you own land!
command-error-nomember: [ERROR] This player is not a member of {0}!
command-error-playerin: [ERROR] This player is already part of {0}!
command-error-noplayer: [ERROR] No player by the name {0} exists!
command-error-ismember: [ERROR] You are already part of a {0}!
command-error-badperms: [ERROR] You do not have the permission to {0}!
command-error-notadmin: [ERROR] You do not have admin privileges to {0}!
command-error-nametook: [ERROR] There is already a {0} using that name!
command-error-tooearly: [ERROR] It is too early to do this, wait {0}!
command-error-argument: [ERROR] Too many or too little arguments {0}!
command-error-cantfind: [ERROR] Could not find any {0} by that name!
command-error-needvote: [ERROR] This requires a vote of atleast {0}!
command-error-notexist: [ERROR] Nothing by the names of {0} exists!
command-error-noaccess: [ERROR] You are not a member of {0}!
command-error-notatwar: [ERROR] You are not at war with {0}!
command-error-nopartof: [ERROR] You are not part of any {0}!
command-message-invite: {0} has invited you to join {1}, will you accept the offer?
command-message-accept: {0} has accepted the invitation to join the {1}.
command-message-reject: {0} has rejected the invitation to join the {1}.
command-message-become: {0} has requested to join {1}, may they be allowed?
command-message-voting: {0} has initiated a vote to {1}, cast your vote now!
command-message-rebels: {0} has incited a rebellion against {1}, who will you side with?
command-message-treaty: {0} and {1} have signed a peace treaty, hostilities have ended.
command-message-peaces: {0} has sued for peace in it's war with {1}.
command-message-peacea: {0} has has accepted {1}'s offer of peace!
command-message-peacer: {0} has has rejected {1}'s offer of peace!
kingdomguide-texts: Kingdoms and Soldiers Kingdoms are civilizations that exist in the world created by players used to distinguish themselves as political entities that govern land, tax the populace, raise soldiers, and rule as they see fit. Kingdoms are used as a way to better distinguish friend from foe, however unless a kingdom has declared war on another the two sides will remain neutral. Soldiers are dependent mobs that will guard areas, follow their leader, and fight for them. While soldiers will fight for their country, their first priority is fighting for their leaders. If a citizen of a kingdom rebels, for instance, the soldiers under the command of that citizen will also become hostile to the kingdom. Additionally, soldiers cannot typically be harmed by other players unless at war or by their leader. Outposts are rally points for soldiers. These outposts act as a central hub for soldiers who won't stray too far from it. Different types of outposts have different stats depending on material and fuel. These outposts are used as a central respawn point for soldiers that get lost or die. Each death of a soldier will result in one token being subtracted however, which can eventually destroy the outpost completely.
